data.title: Books Tell You Why, Inc
data.meta_description: Binding: 1/4 Cloth Book Condition: Very Good+ in Very Good+ dust jacket Edition: First Edition; First Printing Publisher: New York: Scribner, 1997. ISBN: 0684195437
data.text:
A Very Good+ first edition/first printing with bumping to the corners and wear to the spine edges, also a previous owner's name inked and dated on the front pastedown and flyleaf, in a like dust-jacket with light soiling and general wear to the jacket.

Jimmy Carter: A Comprehensive Biography traces the life of the 39th president of the United States from his childhood on the family farm in Plains, Georgia, to his years in the United States Senate and his election as president in 1976. The book covers Carter's controversial presidency, including his efforts to end the Vietnam War, his efforts to reduce the United States' energy consumption, and his response to the Iranian hostage crisis. The book also includes detailed analyses of Carter's policies and decisions, as well as interviews with key figures in Carter's life.; 8vo; 553 pages.

Price: $60.00
